It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant has a compact growth habit with small, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, producing a delicate, pale blue or purple color. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and somewhat elusive species.
